sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A warning for the wise, a feare to the fond, a bridle to the lewde, and a glasse to the good Written of the late earthquake chanced in London and other places, the. 6. of April 1580. for the glorie of God, and benefite of men that warely can walke, and wisely can iudge. Set forth in verse and prose, by Thomas Churchyard Gentleman. Seen and allowed. Churchyard, Thomas, 1520?-1604.
[32] p.
By Iohn Allde, and Nicholas Lyng [and Henry Bynneman?]: and are to be solde [by Nicholas Ling] at the weast dore of Paules Church, Imprinted at London : Anno 1580. April. 8.
Partly in verse. Bookseller's name from STC. "Bynneman may have pr[inted]. at least A4"--STC. Signatures: A-B⁴ C. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Set forth in verse and prose, by Thomas Churchyard Gentleman. Seen and allowed. Churchyard, Thomas, 1520?-1604.

By Iohn Allde, and Nicholas Lyng [and Henry Bynneman?]: and are to be solde [by Nicholas Ling] at the weast dore of Paules Church, Imprinted at London : Anno 1580. April. 8.
Partly in verse. Bookseller's name from STC. "Bynneman may have pr[inted]. at least A4"--STC. Signatures: A-B⁴ C. The last leaf is blank. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

Henry Bynneman?]:
